verses.text: \sc The\sc* word of the \sc Lord\sc* that came to Micah the Morasthite in the days of Jotham, Ahaz, \add and\add* Hezekiah, kings of Judah, which he saw concerning Samaria and Jerusalem.
Hear, all ye people; Hearken, O earth, and all that therein is: And let the Lord \sc God\sc* be witness against you, The Lord from his holy temple.
For behold, the \sc Lord\sc* cometh forth out of his place, And will come down and tread upon the high places of the earth.
And the mountains shall be molten under him, And the valleys shall be cleft, As wax before the fire, \add And\add* as the waters \add that are\add* poured down a steep place.

For the transgression of Jacob \add is\add* all this, And for the sins of the house of Israel. What \add is\add* the transgression of Jacob? \add is it\add* not Samaria? And what \add are\add* the high places of Judah? \add are they\add* not Jerusalem?
Therefore I will make Samaria as a heap of the field, \add And\add* as plantings of a vineyard: And I will pour down the stones thereof into the valley, And I will discover the foundations thereof.

And all the graven images thereof shall be beaten to pieces, And all the hires thereof shall be burnt with the fire, And all the idols thereof will I lay desolate: For she gathered \add it\add* of the hire of a harlot, And they shall return to the hire of a harlot.
Therefore I will wail and howl, I will go stript and naked: I will make a wailing like the dragons, And mourning as the owls.
For her wound \add is\add* incurable; For it is come unto Judah; He is come unto the gate of my people, \add even\add* to Jerusalem.
Declare ye \add it\add* not at Gath, weep ye not at all: In the house of Aphrah roll thyself \add in\add* the dust.
Pass ye away, thou inhabitant of Saphir, having \add thy\add* shame naked: The inhabitant of Zaanan came not forth \add in\add* the mourning of Beth-ezel; He shall receive of you his standing.
For the inhabitant of Maroth waited carefully for good: But evil came down from the \sc Lord\sc* unto the gate of Jerusalem.
O thou inhabitant of Lachish, bind the chariot to the swift beast: She \add is\add* the beginning of the sin to the daughter of Zion: For the transgressions of Israel were found in thee.
Therefore shalt thou give presents to Moresheth-gath: The houses of Achzib \add shall be\add* a lie to the kings of Israel.
Yet will I bring an heir unto thee, O inhabitant of Mareshah: He shall come unto Adullam the glory of Israel.
Make thee bald, and poll thee for thy delicate children; Enlarge thy baldness as the eagle; For they are gone into captivity from thee.
